result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Michael Linden

records.addlTxt: by DHS. Signed by EFV on 11/3/22. ec: Attys, email: Vicki, DHS w/ complaint. kma

1:52 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Alec Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin, Defendant Anthony Michael Linden in court, in custody.  Attorney Alex Stormont in court for Anthony Michael Linden. INCLUDES 22CF478 (STC) and 22CF739 (Set for PH). Atty. Stormont raises competency concerns. Court reviews files. 22CF478: Court finds that it is probable that DE committed offense. 22CF739: Court finds that it is probable that DE committed offense. Court orders competency examination of DE. Court sets Competency Hearing. Adjourned: 2:02 PM. kma
Competency hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Competency hearing on December 7, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Administratively transferred to Branch II by Branch III. kma

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony Michael Linden
Current: 1017 Union St Apt 2, Emporia, KS 66801 United States  (Effective: 10-31-2022)
Prior: 4690 Cty Rd A, Hudson, WI 54016 United States

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing [or/and] random ETG testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

1:37 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: C. Dillon, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Anthony Michael Linden in court, in custody.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Anthony Michael Linden.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF739 (INIT) & 22CF478 (RW- Branch II).  Court questions Atty Satorius on qualification for PD.  DE to call PD's office to see if he qualifies.  DE updates address.  As to 22CF739-   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Court administratively assigns 22CF739 to Branch II. DE requests Court to read the charges off complaint.  Argument by DE to Court. Bond argument.  Court orders bond.  Adjourned at 1:43
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 3, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
